thread.title: Murray's MW rankings: Key league matchups galore
thread.title_full: Murray's MW rankings: Key league matchups galore

title: Murray's MW rankings: Key league matchups galore
text:
Murray's MW rankings: Key league matchups galore Murray's Mountain West football rankings Each week, RGJ sports writer Chris Murray will rank the Mountain West football teams. Here are this week's rankings, with each team's overall record, next opponent and a comment. Sponsored by 
Last week: Beat Colorado State, 41-10 
This week: at Utah State 
Comment: Boise State gets its first real test since a 35-24 loss to BYU on Sept. 12. Since then, it's been routs of Idaho State, Virginia, Hawaii and Colorado State to the tune of a 204-24 scoring advantage (Virginia should have been a test but the Broncos destroyed them). Boise State has whipped Utah State over the years, too, with a 31.1-point win margin per game in the last 10 matchups between the schools. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Beat Fresno State, 56-14 
This week: vs. Boise State 
Comment: Utah State has righted the ship after a rough start to the season. A win over Boise State would make the Mountain Division race a lot more interesting. It would give the Aggies essentially a two-game lead over the Broncos when you include the head-to-head tiebreaker, but Boise State is playing like the Broncos of 2006-12 right now. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Beat Wyoming, 31-17 
This week: at Colorado State 
Comment: I'm still not 100 percent sold on Air Force given who it has beaten, but the Falcons are one of only three teams in the conference with a winning record and took a double-digit win over my No. 4 team (SJSU), so it has to be in the top three. A win at Colorado State would cement the Falcons as an upper-echelon MW team. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Beat UNLV, 33-27 (OT) 
This week: vs. San Diego State 
Comment: The winner of the SJSU-SDSU game is the team to beat in the West Division. SJSU is at home and if it wants to show it's a team to be reckoned with it has to defend home field and win this game. In a league that is short on capable quarterbacks, SJSU has two in Joey Gray and Kenny Potter. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Beat Hawaii, 28-14 
This week: at San Jose State 
Comment: As I wrote two weeks ago, when SDSU was 1-3 and looked horrible, "Don't count the Aztecs out of the West Division race." And a win this week over SJSU would put SDSU in a great position - 3-0 in league with two road wins - and firmly make the Aztecs the team to beat in the division. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Lost to Boise State, 41-10 
This week: vs. Air Force 
Comment: The backend of Colorado State's schedule is extremely soft but the Rams could use a win here to have a little margin for error in its quest for a third straight bowl berth. Air Force has won eight of the last nine games in this series, so this rivalry hasn't been too friendly to the Rams. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Beat to SJSU, 33-27 (OT) 
This week: at Fresno State 
Comment: UNLV lost a golden opportunity when it fell to SJSU at home last week, but the good news is the Rebels are competitive against solid teams. That's rare for this program. A six-point favorite at Fresno State this week, the Rebels look for back-to-back road wins for the first time since 2013. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Beat New Mexico, 35-17 
This week: vs. Wyoming 
Comment: Nevada did a nice job of responding from a tough loss to UNLV and now heads to the road, where it is 5-2 over the last seven games. The Wolf Pack can't trip up against winless Wyoming if it wants to win the West Division. Nevada will once again ride RBs Don Jackson and James Butler, who are the only two teammates in the FBS to average at least 94 rushing yards per game in 2015. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Lost to SDSU, 28-14 
This week: at New Mexico 
Comment: It might be time for Hawaii to cut the cord on QB Max Wittek, who has hit only 44.9 percent of his passes with five touchdowns, eight interceptions and a 22.3 QBR rating, which is one of the worst in the nation. Wittek is a one-read quarterback who struggles if you take his first look. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Lost to Nevada, 35-17 
This week: vs. Hawaii 
Comment: You have to wonder if New Mexico's improvement is a bit of a mirage. The Lobos' three wins this year are against Wyoming, New Mexico State and Mississippi Valley State, which are a combined 0-17, with five of those losses coming to FCS schools. Not exactly a marque win in the mix. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Lost to Utah State, 56-14 
This week: vs. UNLV 
Comment: Honestly, Fresno State deserves the bottom spot. This is how bad things are: The Bulldogs are a six-point underdog at home against UNLV. This from a team that was in the Top 25 two years ago. Coach Tim DeRuyter makes the most of any head coach in the MW ($1,457,745 last year). His contract runs through 2018, so his job is safe, but he has to get this thing turned around quickly. Mountain West rankings 
Last week: Lost to Air Force, 31-17 
This week: vs. Nevada 
Comment: If Wyoming wants to win a game in October, it better win this week. The Cowboys go on the road to Boise State (that will be as ugly as the Broncos want to make it) and then to Utah State (also ugly) after that. A loss this week and Wyoming will be winless as it enters the final month of the season. Chris Murray RGJ Chris Murray , cmurray@rgj.com 9:43 a.m. PDT October 13, 2015 Wolf Pack quarterback Tyler Stewart passes after faking a hand-off to running back James Butler during their win over New Mexico. (Photo: Lance Iversen/USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE
